name: freshness
content:
freshness noun [U]
(OF FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being in a new, natural condition and not old or preserved by processes such as freezing: We pride ourselves on the freshness of our produce. The freshness of an egg is very important in cooking. The device could be used in the food industry to test products for freshness.
More examplesFewer examplesGardeners can ensure the freshness of their produce by using proper harvesting, handling, and storage techniques. Coffee pods are best for freshness because they are individually packaged. Customers who are wary of buying meat have several options to ensure freshness.Grind whole spices for freshness and flavour.

freshness noun [U]
(NEWNESS)
the quality of being new or original, and usually therefore interesting: Her music has a wonderful freshness. The inclusion of new teams has brought freshness and interest to the tournament.
More examplesFewer examplesShe has injected freshness and energy into a somewhat stuffy art form.He notes a freshness in the way filmmakers are tackling traditional Canadian themes.There was a real freshness in his views.The book has been on the shelves for three-quarters of a century without losing any of its freshness.

freshness noun [U]
(RECENT)
the quality of having recently happened, or seeming to have recently happened: The freshness of the memory made it feel like it had all happened only yesterday.
More examplesFewer examplesHis photographs and accounts preserve the freshness of recent travel.From the freshness of the tracks, their killing of a cub bear, and the marks of their fires, it seemed evident they were not twenty-four hours ahead of us.
